creator: qualita1

title: Mails received have the received date as when I opened Thunderbird
content:
I have a camera setup that sends an email when motion is detected. The mail headers have a received field with a datetime corresponding (roughly) to the moment the detection occurred (as UTC+0). When I open Thunderbird it will show all the mails via IMAP with "Date" and "Received" as the moment Thunderbird will fetch them, not the actual received date. Thunderbird will remember these dates. Since all the dates are the same, it makes it impossible to order the mails by date received. Ordering the mails by subject is not 100% correct as the dates in the subject are not YYYYMMDD formatted (as UTC+2).

I'm using Thunderbird 115.3.2 on Arch Linux (x86_64). This issue was also present in 102, I'm not sure of 91, as I held off for Supernova before making this report.

Please see the attached images for clarification.
creator: InFerYes

title: Synchronizing multiple calendars - automatically copy events from one calendar to another
content:
Hi,

Is there a way to synchronize data between calendars in thunderbird, or with an extension? I am looking for something that works like the outlook caldav synchronizer (https://caldavsynchronizer.org/).

This tool uploads all events I enter in the outlook calendar, to the google calendar, and vice versa.

In the case of Thunderbird, I'd like events I enter in the "home" calendar, to be synchronized with the google calendar I have also attached. I don't want to be forced to select the google calendar every time I add a new event.

downloaded the last version of tb. looks promising, but the layout so far is a pain.... the download new messages is tiny.... i was searching for it.meanwhile the new message is huge.cant we at least make it also blue? the search bar on top is useless for me and a bit ugly. i need to search through emails mostly, so i use the filter and refine.... cant locate the refine now. also, i cant get it to read - search the mails. i can only search by sender or subject.


i am using a table view and preview on the bottom. it completely destroyed my preferred columns. lines are so condensed that i can barely set them apart. its what yahoo did with compact layout. changing fonts doesnt help all that much.

on the left the mail, adress book, calendar, chat, can be moved inwards, for example under the "get messages " also vertical.

the filter messages , show unread, attachment etc and be fitted up between inbox and refine to save space.

finally, on the table, the very last column on the right, no matter what it is, it can NOT be resized!

title: Double-clicking the T-Bird Inbox icon does not refresh the Inbox, but restarting the T-Bird app does.
content:
Hello,

I just did a fresh install of the latest version (115.4.1 64-bit) of Thunderbird on my Win10-64bit system. I have over 1TB of SSD memory available on my Intel i7-12700K DDR5 system and no other significant applications are running. When I sent an email to an account I had set up on it, I at first thought T-Bird was simply slow to receive emails because it was taking over a minute to get them. During that time I repeatedly double-clicked the Inbox item in the account tree to try to get it to refresh but it didn't seem to matter. However, I finally tried simply restarting T-Bird immediately after sending the email and to my surprise the email was available in the Inbox immediately. I cleared the cache and tried running in the troubleshooting mode but it didn't matter. Am I misunderstanding how to refresh the Inbox or is there some different way to do it in the newest T-Bird version?

Thank you in advance :-) Ray
creator: RayMitchell1

title: Outgoing email has stopped since Thunderbird update
content:
Outgoing smtp from Thunderbird has stopped since update. I have reviewed all the documentation and been in contact with my provider and still have been unable to resolve the problem. I am very frustrated with this issue. I attempted the SSL/TLS reversion back to version 1 and this did not help.

I have tried changing the port number to that suggested my my provider which for outgoing is supposed to be 587, although 24 has always worked. They also suggested changing the server name to mail.twc.com which did not work. They suggested the full email in the User Name field, which I did with various combinations of port numbers and server names and none have worked.

When I attempt to send I get the following error: The message could not be sent because connecting to Outgoing server (SMTP) smtp-server.rochester.rr.com failed. The server may be unavailable or is refusing SMTP connections. Please verify that your Outgoing server (SMTP) settings are correct and try again.

When I use changed settings as described above I just get a timed out error as though there is no connection at all.

Screenshot of SMTP settings as they have always been attached. Email provider rochester.rr.com. ISP Spectrum. No firewall. Virus protection Bitdefender v. 27.0.23.112. OS Windows 11 Home build 22621.2428. Thunderbird version 115.4.1

Please assist
creator: pcharron

title: Newest Thunderbird version doesn't work with my internet provider
content: In August I stopped being able to send out emails through Thunderbird, but I still was getting incoming mail. My family are all computer nerds but they couldn't figure it out. I talked to the Spectrum Help and they figured out what changes to make in the Thunderbird settings for port numbers to make the new version work, but there was one last change they couldn't manage. They figured out that there needs to be a place in the Thunderbird settings to put in my Spectrum password, for incoming mail. There is one for outgoing mail (the choices were to put in the password or to click on "not necessary", and I used "not necessary") but there is no choice for incoming mail. With the changes they made, I can no longer get incoming or outgoing mail, so I have had to use the Spectrum website to manage the email and it is absolutely horrible, limited, disorganized and very, very slow. I desperately need to fix this. I need to talk to someone in real time, but I can't find a phone number on your website. Please send me a phone number I can call, or you call me at [phone# removed from public support forum]. Thanks.

title: Calendar not working properly
content:
Hello,

I checked the Help website and couldn't find my specific calendar issue.

After the latest update my Thunderbird calendar no longer seems to work properly. I'm using Thunderbird 115.4.1 64bit on Windows 11 64bit. I have checked for updates for Thunderbird, Windows, and any add-ons. All appear to be up to date.

While some appointments are there, others aren't. I checked my calendar website and it looks correct there and all my appointments are there. Also, all my appointments are showing/correct on my phone as well. It's just in Thunderbird that things aren't correct.

I can add and delete appointments without any issues, but if I add an appointment that was listed previously but no longer showing in Thunderbird, it shows up twice on my phone and the calendar website.

It doesn't seem to matter the method used to add the previous (or new) appointments as there's a mixture of appointments showing that have been added using different methods/platforms (i.e. phone, website, or Thunderbird).

I do use the Owl add-on, but I emailed them several days ago and I haven't received a reply so I thought maybe they didn't consider it to be an Owl issue so have just ignored it. Also, I use Owl for my emails as well and they're working properly.

Any help you could provide would be greatly appreciated.

Thanks,

Steve

title: TB 115 message search results no longer open to the email I want resend when I click it
content:
Just migrated to Thunderbird 115 and noticing a lot of issues (as others have posted about). I don't know if there is a solution to this one:

When I search for emails from a given customer I get a search results page in TB 115 that looks like all older versions of TB. It gives subject line, date sent, and first few lines of message which makes it easy to find a generic message that I just want to resend to a new prospect without re-typing everything.

In previous version of TB when I click that email it would open up in the next window and then be ready to read. I could just do "control-E" to open a new "send message window" from there, just change the recipient, and off it goes.

Now in TB 115, clicking on the old message I want to resend opens up a window that just shows the collapsed thread of all kinds of messages I might have sent before and after that message I'm trying to recycle. I uncollapse the thread and then see dozens of replies and messages that went back and forth to a customer over many dates and times.

NOW I have to figure out which date and time is the message in the thread that I'm trying to copy instead of it just opening to the one message I just chose from the search results page.

I can have the message pane open and it gives me just the sender's name and dates sent of the first few messages in the thread before I uncollapse it, so that does not seem to be the answer. Clicking on a message in the uncollapsed thread lets me read more of it, but I still have to dig around all the messages in the thread to find the right email I had just clicked on in the search results page. Or jot down the time and date of what I'm looking for to narrow it down faster.

Is anyone familiar with this situation? Or have a fix for it?

Version 102 which I just left was simple and quick to use and I've been using "contol-E" for something like 20 years. The function still works in TB 115 but now they have made it much harder to get to the message you want to re-copy or resend. If you run a business there are dozens of messages you are re-using and now it's become a much harder process to find them and resend them.

Thanks
creator: cvs33

title: Thundirbird not retrieving emails
content: G'day, I have a problem with Thunderbird not retrieving or sending emails, no error messages, the usual information that shows logging in to account on the bottom bar just shows "done", I hit the "get new message, all accounts" and nothing, it does not show any attempt to log in at all and shows "done" checked the connection security and its STARTTL, I tried switching to SSL/TLS made no difference at all. The thing is it went from working to not working in about 15 minutes, I am with Westnet and can still log in via their webmail link using the same login info that is set for Thunderbird.
creator: brett.christoffel

title: thunderbird crashing
content:
I am using version 115.3.3 just today I started having problems. My default Windows virus checker did not identify any issues and I ran malware bytes and it showed zero problems. the problem seemed to start at the point when I forwarded a 5mb file to a few friends. Since then, I have been unable to send anything. The system continues to crash. Most of the time I cannot see any information in pull down lists. I have tried rolling back to a week old restore point and it continues to have the probem. I have tried updating to 115.4.1 and it still has the problem. I have removed all of the automatic installed updates from the last two days and still have the problem..... HELP!

I am not sure I will see emails back from this help request, but I sure hope so:)
creator: bpasok12345

title: Set up my essential account: an IMAP account port 25 no ssl. The account as built was SMTP, not IMAP.
content:
Account creation = other? I'm going to try v102. I loaded v115.4.1 on a new machine - old one dead att. I haven't created an IMAP/port25 combination for some time so I have no idea of when the issue resurfaced. Error message to the effect that the target doesn't accept SMTP. To modify the account I am set to the SMTP editor. It seems to me maybe an 'are you sure?' message could be issued wrt to the port 25 designation, but not correcting a non-existent error ; it's up to the ISP - not us. This used to be an issue; but not since the protocol became an entry. So it seems we are once again overriding the desired protocol based upon the port number. This one of those issues with the ISP filtering out port 25 on output - the ISP insists on the IMAP/port 25.. ... There instructions: OIGP.net & OutreachInternet.com Email Server Settings Server Type: IMAP Username: (enter your full email address) Incoming Mail Server: mail.oigp.net Port: 143 Security: No SSL Authentication: none

Outgoing Mail Server: mail.oigp.net Port: 25 Security: No SSL Authentication method: Requires Normal Password

Some programs may require you to manually configure them in order to get the proper settings.
creator: dick28

title: Upgrade to 115.4.1 / hyperlinks within emails no longer open.

Right-clicking and selecting 'open in browser' fails to open the link as well. This was never an issue until this update. I am on a Win 11 desktop with Chrome set as my default browser. Please advise - I love this tool!

title: Emails that have already been downloaded are downloaded again when I restart Thunderbird.
content: Hello, I have a problem with Thunderbird. Emails that have already been downloaded to my inbox are downloaded again when I restart Thunderbird at a later time. This problem started suddenly a few weeks ago after I was informed that Thunderbird had been "improved". I have tried to find a solution online. I found that many people seem to be having similar problems. I tried to follow various people's suggestions to fix the problem. But, I am not a software developer, so trying to do this is not easy for me. I never know if I am going to create a new problem. In spite of my efforts I still have a problem. Can someone suggest a step by step way of fixing my problem that a person with limited programming experience could actually use?
